1554165337_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf.body:
There is something like this in Linux, it is called ram compression. This works by compressing part of memory by compression algorithm(such as xz). Downsize is slight increase of cpu and decrease on memory speed due compression and decompression. Still quite cool tech. More modern approach source-code for linux can be found here https://github.com/Nefelim4ag/systemd-swap .  

This benefits mostly machines whit limited ram(less than 3 gb) or some weird usage, I didn't find much difference on performance when using it.
